title: الْحِكَايَة
description: Learn about الحكاية - the grammatical treatment of quoted speech and words in classical Arabic, including direct quotation and metalinguistic reference.

notes.title: What is الحكاية?
content: الحِكَايَة is the grammatical phenomenon of quoting words or speech exactly as they were said, preserving their original form. The quoted element is called مَحْكِيّ (quoted).
In حكاية, the quoted word or phrase maintains its original إعراب regardless of its position in the new sentence. This is essential for understanding classical texts.

examples.english: He said: 'Praise be to Allah' (exact quote)
I heard 'There is no god but Allah'
He wrote: 'In the name of Allah...'
The quoted does not change

notes.title: Types of الحكاية
content: There are two main types: حِكَايَة الْجُمَل (quoting sentences) and حِكَايَة الْمُفْرَدَات (quoting individual words). The first is for reported speech, the second for metalinguistic reference.
حكاية الجمل preserves the entire sentence. حكاية المفردات is used when discussing words themselves, as in grammar books.

examples.english: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Actions are by intentions'
'Daraba' is a past tense verb (word quotation)
'Zayd' is a noun in nominative (metalinguistic)
The meaning of 'al-hamd' is praise

notes.title: الحكاية بالحرف
content: الحكاية بالحرف means quoting letter-by-letter or word-for-word. This is used in grammar explanations when referring to words as linguistic objects rather than their meanings.
When a word is محكيّ, it becomes مبني (indeclinable) in its quoted position, though its internal structure remains unchanged.

examples.english: The letter 'ba' is a preposition
The word 'Allah' is the word of majesty
'Min' is a particle, 'man' is a noun
Like 'Zayd stood' (quoting example)

notes.title: الحكاية في الأسماء المبهمة
content: When asking about someone's name using مَنْ, the response can use حكاية - echoing the case of the question. If asked 'مَنْ جَاءَ؟' (nominative), the answer can be 'مَنْ؟' echoing the رفع.
This is particularly relevant in classical texts where names are introduced with their full i'rab maintained.

examples.english: Who came? I said: Zayd (echoing nominative)
You saw whom? I said: Zayd (echoing accusative)
You passed by whom? I said: by Zayd (echoing genitive)
Quotation follows the i'rab

notes.title: الحكاية في الشعر والنثر
content: In poetry and classical prose, حكاية allows authors to quote verses, proverbs, and famous sayings exactly. This preserves the original wording and rhythm.
Scholars use حكاية extensively when citing evidence (شواهد) from Quran, Hadith, and poetry to support grammatical rules.

examples.english: As His saying: 'Your Lord is not unjust'
In the hadith: 'Religion is sincere advice'
As the poet said: '...'
The evidence is his saying: '...'

notes.title: إعراب المحكي
content: The محكيّ (quoted element) is مبني على ما سُمِع به (built on what was heard). It has no i'rab change. In sentence analysis, it's described as: مَحْكِيٌّ لَا مَحَلَّ لَهُ، or في محل according to context.
If the quoted element functions as مفعول به of a verb of saying, the entire quote is في محل نصب مفعول به.
keyPoints: Quote as مفعول به of قال

examples.arabic: «الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ»: جملة محكية في محل نصب
examples.english: 'Praise be to Allah': quoted sentence as object
'Daraba': quoted word, indeclinable
His saying 'There is no god but Allah' is truth
The quoted is indeclinable

exercises.prompt: الْحِكَايَةُ هِيَ نَقْلُ الْكَلَامِ كَمَا _____ بِهِ
exercises.promptEn: الحكاية is conveying speech as it was _____
The quoted element in حكاية is called _____

exercises.prompt: «ضَرَبَ» فِعْلٌ مَاضٍ - هَذَا مِثَالٌ عَلَى حِكَايَةِ _____
exercises.promptEn: 'Daraba' is a past verb - this is an example of _____ quotation
The quoted element is _____ on what was heard

exercises.prompt: قَالَ: «الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ» - الْجُمْلَةُ الْمَحْكِيَّةُ فِي مَحَلِّ _____ مَفْعُولٌ بِهِ
exercises.promptEn: He said: 'Praise be to Allah' - the quoted sentence is in the position of _____ as object
الحكاية بالحرف means quoting _____ by letter
